MagneticSolutionCartStatic

class pyrit.solution.MagneticSolutionCartStatic(description: str, vector_potential: ndarray, tri_mesh: mesh.TriMesh, tri_cart_edge_shape_function: shapefunction.TriCartesianEdgeShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations)

Bases: StaticSolution

Solution of a static, two-dimensional magnetic problem in Cartesian coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is MagneticProblemCartStatic.

Constructor

Parameters

  • description (str) – Description of the solution.

  • vector_potential (np.ndarray) – An array that represents the potential.

  • tri_mesh (mesh.TriMesh) – The mesh object.

  • tri_cart_edge_shape_function (shapefunction.TriCartesianEdgeShapeFunction) – The shape function object.

  • regions (region.Regions) – The regions object.

  • materials (material.Materials) – The materials object.

  • excitations (excitations.Excitations) – The excitations object.

Methods

absolute_field

Computes the absolute field.

consistency_check

Check if the solution is consistent.

energy_in_regions

Compute the energy in certain regions.

initialize_attributes

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

load

Load a solution.

plot_b_field

Plot the magnetic flux density.

plot_current_density

Plot the current density.

plot_energy_density

Plot the energy density.

plot_equilines

Plot the equilines of the vector potential.

plot_h_field

Plot the magnetic field strength.

plot_load_vector

Plot the load vector.

plot_vector_potential

Plot the vector potential.

Saves the solution instance.

Create a static solution from a static problem.

Attributes

b_field

Magnetic flux density.

curlcurl_matrix

The curl-curl-matrix.

current_density

The current density.

energy

The energy in the whole domain.

energy_density

The energy density.

h_field

Magnetic field strength.

ignore_for_saving

List of attributes that are not saved

length

The length of the domain.

load_vector

The load vector.

mass_one

The identity mass matrix.

solution_identifier

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

vector_potential

The vector potential.

vector_potential_field_values

The field values of the vector potential.
solution_identifier: str = 'Solution of a static, tow-dimensional magnetostatic problem in Cartesian coordinates'

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

ignore_for_saving = ['_b_field', '_h_field', '_curlcurl_matrix', '_mass_one', '_load_vector']

List of attributes that are not saved

consistency_check()

Check if the solution is consistent.

property length: float

The length of the domain.

property vector_potential: ndarray

The vector potential. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

Note that this vector does not represent the values of \(\vec{A}\). See the property vector_potential_field_values.

property vector_potential_field_values

The field values of the vector potential.

property b_field: ndarray

Magnetic flux density. Array with two values (x- and y-component) per mesh element.

property h_field: ndarray

Magnetic field strength. Array with two values (x- and y-component) per mesh element.

property curlcurl_matrix: coo_matrix

The curl-curl-matrix.

property load_vector: ndarray

The load vector. Array with one value per mesh node.

property mass_one: coo_matrix

The identity mass matrix.

property current_density: ndarray

The current density.

property energy: float

The energy in the whole domain.

property energy_density: ndarray

The energy density. Array with one value per mesh node.

energy_in_regions(*region_ids: int) → float

Compute the energy in certain regions.

Parameters

region_ids (int) – Region IDs of the regions to compute the energy in.

Returns

energy – The energy

Return type

float

:raises ValueError : When the region of one ID is not two-dimensional.:

plot_equilines(**kwargs)

Plot the equilines of the vector potential. This is in direction of the b field.

static absolute_field(field: ndarray)

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

field (np.ndarray) – The field. A (N,2) or a (2,N) array.

Returns

absolute_field – The absolute value of the field. A (N,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

initialize_attributes()

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Solution

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution – A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) –

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

classmethod solution_from_problem(description: str, problem: StaticProblem, solution: ndarray) → StaticSolution

Create a static solution from a static problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) – Description of the static solution.

  • problem (StaticProblem) – A static problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the static problem.

Returns

static_solution

Return type

StaticSolution
